title: feat(viewer): generate circuitJsonKey from per-element bounds and refactor into util
description: Refactors the computation of circuitJsonKey in PCBViewer to use a new utility that generates a stable, content-based key from PCB element bounds and IDs, ensuring keys change only with meaningful content changes.
body:
## Summary

This PR refactors how the `circuitJsonKey` is computed in `PCBViewer`.  
Instead of relying on the array length and `editCount`, we now generate a stable, content-based key using a new utility: `calculateCircuitJsonKey`.

## Changes

- Added **`lib/calculate-circuit-json-key.ts`**:
  - Computes a signature for all `pcb_` elements in the circuit JSON.
  - Uses bounding box values (rounded to 4 decimal places) and element IDs.
  - Produces a deterministic hash to ensure keys change only when PCB content meaningfully changes.
- Updated **`PCBViewer.tsx`**:
  - Replaced inline `circuitJsonKey` calculation with `useMemo(calculateCircuitJsonKey)`.
  - Ensures memoization only recomputes when `circuitJson` changes.

title: fix: support -ve rotation
description: Fixes incorrect handling of negative rotation angles in PCB element transformations, ensuring proper rendering for -90 rotations.
body: **Root cause:** - Odd-90° detection uses: Math.round(tsr.rotation.angle / (Math.PI / 2)) % 2 === 1 - For a -90° matrix, Math.round(-1) === -1 and in JS (-1 % 2) === -1, not 1 → condition is false. ref - https://github.com/tscircuit/core/issues/1240

title: Fix: Correctly resolve nets across subcircuit boundaries for schematic routing

title: Fix: Duplicate overlapping net labels in schematic rendering
description: Fixes duplicate overlapping net labels in schematic rendering due to coordination issues between different net label algorithms.
body:
/claim #1203
/fixes #1203

## Root Cause
Two functions were creating net labels without proper coordination:
- [applyNetLabelPlacements()](cci:1://file:///Users/anassarkiz/ts/core/lib/components/primitive-components/Group/Group_doInitialSchematicTraceRender/applyNetLabelPlacements.ts:12:0-131:1) created labels from trace solver suggestions
- [insertNetLabelsForPortsMissingTrace()](cci:1://file:///Users/anassarkiz/ts/core/lib/components/primitive-components/Group/Group_doInitialSchematicTraceRender/insertNetLabelsForPortsMissingTrace.ts:5:0-76:1) added duplicate labels due to placement discrepancy between different net label algorithms (solver-based vs port-based placement)

## Solution
Enhanced duplicate detection in [insertNetLabelsForPortsMissingTrace.ts](cci:7://file:///Users/anassarkiz/ts/core/lib/components/primitive-components/Group/Group_doInitialSchematicTraceRender/insertNetLabelsForPortsMissingTrace.ts:0:0-0:0):
- **Increased tolerance** from `1e-6` to `0.1` to account for placement discrepancy between different net label algorithms
- **Improved logic** to properly coordinate between solver-based and port-based label placement
- **Removed debug logs** for clean production code

title: fix: don't conditionally run hooks
description: Fixes a bug where hooks were conditionally run based on the presence of a query, ensuring hooks are always executed properly.

title: regression fix starring package didn't reflect change
description: Fixes regression where starring a package did not update the UI to reflect the change in star status.

title: style(release-detail): adjust image background colors based on view type
description: Adjusts the background colors of images in the release detail page based on the view type (PCB or schematic).

title: feat: surface image generation logs
description: Expose image generation build info in API and schema, show image generation logs on preview and build details pages, and test that package releases return image generation fields.
body:
## Summary
- expose image generation build info in API and schema
- show image generation logs on preview and build details pages
- test that package releases return image generation fields

## Testing
- `bun run lint`

- `bun test`

body: - Add the option for `555 timer` as one of the suggested actions

title: Fix issues with small sloating point errors causing incorrect path construction
description: Fixes small floating point errors causing incorrect path construction in elbow calculations
body:
- **repro elbow issue**
- **fix "not exact match" for y coodinateds**
- **fix small x offset issues**

title: Add a center pad so that components avoid packing inside other components
description: This pull request introduces a new feature that adds a center pad to components, which helps prevent them from overlapping with other components during the packing process. This is achieved by modifying the buildPackedComponent function to include an optional parameter shouldAddInnerObstacles, which, when set to true, creates an inner pad that represents the components bounds. This change is expected to improve the layout of components in the circuit design, ensuring better spacing and organization.

title: Added repro for automatic schematic
description: Adds a reproduction page for the SI7021 schematic, including a JSON input file for layout debugging.

title: refactor: use a single file to access repository permission
description: Refactors the repository access management by consolidating multiple YAML files into a single repositories.yml file for easier management of repository permissions.
body: @seveibar Can you add your PAT token in the secrets to this repo under the variable `ADMIN_TOKEN`? Will merge after that

title: Make the default width `0.45`
description: Changes the default width of net labels from 0.5 to 0.45 to prevent them from vanishing in certain schematic tests.
body: Having the default width as `0.5` makes the netLabel vanish for this schematic test. (Will create a new issue for this) This PR is a kind of a hack so both of these tests net label looks fine - https://github.com/tscircuit/core/pull/1254

title: fix: increase the default width of the netLabel
description: Increases the default horizontal width of the netLabel from 0.4 to 0.5 units.
body: ref - https://github.com/tscircuit/core/issues/1221

title: dont allow long traces, exceeding maxMspPairDistance
description: Fixes the issue of MSP connection pairs being created over too long of a distance by enforcing a maximum Manhattan distance between pins.
body:
- **repro long msp pairs**
- **fix msp connection pairs being created over too long of a distance**

title: Fix Diagonal Traces sometimes appearing
description: Fixes the issue where diagonal traces appear in the schematic trace solver, ensuring that only strictly orthogonal paths are generated.

title: Sort candidate traces by length

body:
## Summary
- order single-line solver candidate paths by path length so shorter traces are tried first
- test that the solver selects the shortest available candidate path

## Testing
